description.narrative: Insatsen syftar till att 1) Höja effektiviteten hos de demokratiska och republikanska institutionerna, nämligen parlamentet, valmyndigheten (CENI), säkerhetsstyrkorna, rättsväsendet, kommunfullmäktige och de politiska partierna för att stärka den demokratiska processen i Burkina Faso. 2) Höja medvetenheten om den rättsliga innebörden av medborgarskap genom utbildning och träning vad gäller styrelsesätt 3) Öka medborgarnas inflytande på den offentliga politiken samt 4) stärka CGD i att utföra sina uppgifter, att påverka frågor om demokratiskt styre. CGD kommer att implementera programmet tillsammans med sina partners. Programmets totala budget uppgår till 15,7 MSEK av vilken CGD:s egna finansiering utgör ca 54 200 SEK. Resterande del finansieras genom givare, varav Sida bidrar med 2,5 MSEK.
Sweden will support for two years CGD's action plan 2015-2017 with a contribution amounting to 2,5 MSEK that will be coordinated and followed up with the other co-financing donor (Denmark).

The overall objective of the contribution was to contribute to the promotion of democracy in Burkina Faso through the creation of knowledge and space for questioning the actors of democratic governance. The programme had four axis of intervention: Axis 1. Strengthening the institutional landscape Main objective : Contribute to strengthening the credibility of state institutions to consolidate the democratic process in Burkina Faso. Specific objective: Increase the effectiveness of state institutions through the diagnostic analysis of their functioning, the formulation of relevant proposals and support for the implementation of the recommendations. Axis 2. Promotion of a civic culture in Burkina Faso Main objective: Contribute to the promotion of citizenship through information and training of governance actors. Specific objectives: Increase the influence of actors and citizens on public policies. Axis 3. Follow-up learning and dissemination of experiences Main objective: Contribute to the consolidation of democratic governance through better sharing of research results and experiences Specific objective: Increase the impact of CGD actions on democratic governance Axis 4. Capacity building of the CGD Main objective: Contribute to improving the institutional and technical capacities of the CGD to promote democratic governance. Specific objective: Strengthen the capacity of the CGD to assume its missions of influence on the issues of democratic governance.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Please find below a summary of the contribution's main results: In regards to strengthening civic culture the following results can be noted: - contributing to the creation of the Présimètre, an accountability mechanism and a framework for citizen participation - promotion of the participation of women in politics with advocacy for the gender quota - the CGD contributed to the advent of the popular uprising October 30 and 31, 2014 and the following organization of democratic elections. At the level of capacity building of the institutions, the CGD initiated training and communications for the benefit of structures such as the national electoral commission (CENI), the National Assembly and municipalities. These actions have contributed to a better functioning of public institutions. For example, at the CENI level, training helped to strengthen the capacity of members and election officials, which contributed to the smooth organisation of the elections. At the level of the National Assembly, the support of the CGD consisted of training and communication sessions organized for the parliamentary groups. These actions have allowed MPs to be better informed on certain issues and to provide more relevant advice. Some elected representatives also state that they are better informed about the role of the deputy in the Assembly and with grassroots populations. Municipalities such as Kokologo and Dori benefited from capacity building actions by the CGD. This support helped to reinforce the control actions on the part of the citizens and the admissibility of the communal agents. Also in the context of institution building, the public service reform process that builds on the studies commissioned by the CGD can be noted. The creation of communication spaces and frameworks for dialogue, the multiplication of communications, the numerous exchange meetings and the restitutions at the grassroots allow elected representatives and citizens to appropriate the principles of good governance and promote best practices.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
